info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 2:22PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 222 PM MST /322 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Bill Williams Mountain, or 25 miles northeast of Chino Valley, moving northeast at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Williams, Bill Williams Mountain, Kaibab Lake, Sherwood Forest Estates, Sycamore Falls, Scholz Lake, Whitehorse Lake, Red Lake, J.D. Dam Lake, Garland Prairie, Parks, H A Clark Memorial Field and Sycamore Canyon Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 153 and 173. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 163 and 165. State Route 89 between mile markers 355 and 356. State Route 64 between mile markers 186 and 194.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... White Horse Lake Campground, Camp Raymond, Dogtown Lake Campground, Kaibab Lake Campground and Bill Williams Campground.
This includes the following swimming holes... Sycamore Falls, Lower Sycamore Falls "The Golden Pond" and Paradise Forks.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT YAVAPAI AND COCONINO COUNTIES UNTIL 245 PM MST /345 PM MDT/

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Yavapai County Mountains; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
